alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Collingsworth; Deaf Smith; Donley; Gray; Hansford; Hemphill; Hutchinson; Lipscomb; Moore; Ochiltree; Oldham; Potter; Randall; Roberts; Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 02 at 2:52AM CDT until June 03 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of the Panhandle of Texas, including the following areas, Armstrong, Carson, Collingsworth, Deaf Smith, Donley, Gray, Hansford, Hemphill, Hutchinson, Lipscomb, Moore, Ochiltree, Oldham, Potter, Randall, Roberts and Wheeler Counties, including Palo Duro Canyon. * WHEN...From 1 PM CDT this afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Extensive street flooding and flooding of creeks and rivers are possible. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An additional round of widespread showers and thunderstorms is expected this afternoon into tonight. While most areas are favored to receive around an inch of rainfall, localized areas could see more than 3 inches. Given saturated soils and full playa lakes due to high amounts of recent rainfall, additional flooding may occur as a result. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Armstrong; Carson; Collingsworth; Deaf Smith; Donley; Gray; Hansford; Hemphill; Hutchinson; Lipscomb; Moore; Ochiltree; Oldham; Potter; Randall; Roberts; Wheeler
